The thing is that your first very layer is what determines your light in watercolor. Since you work backwards, light to dark. So keeping your brightest layer must be like, the one you don't touch. 
But it could be also the watercolor brand you have, some have dull colors per default.

Truly devastated by the death of Akira Toriyama. I started drawing because of Dragon Ball. My artist name is a direct reference to the French name of Puar. I have read Hetappi - Crummy Manga Lab so many time it was literally my bible. He left us too soon. Thank you for everything Sensei.
Nearly every artist of my generation I know was influenced by this man. He created creators. That's the highest aspiration and measure of success I can think of for an artist. RIP sir. 🙏

So yeah, for a first Art Fight, it was a really good experience to me. Plus doing this with some amazing pals all along might be what kept me on drawing. I will do it next year too !

Also I can find a good balance to draw more and yet still taking breaks and do some other things. I think the hardes is really to start. Before starting, my mind always wander and I get anxiety. But now I feel like I broke that barrier and don't fear anymore, so I can start more easily.

This definitely boosted my confidence in drawing and I drew a lot of things out of my comfort zone. I've learned I can draw anything if I try and just not be scared. I tested a lot and I'm ready to try new things !
I made a file compiling what I draw in July and I broke my record 😅. 11 drawings (while I do just around 1-2 per month in comparison), 8 for art fight and 3 reference sheets.

I'm just like, happy to discover new ways of drawing and I've learned so much more than doing actual studies, so that's new to me. I used to make a ton of studies, but somehow it didn't work much or I felt frustrated. Now just the act of creating is teaching me much more !

The thing that art fight taught me is to not be afraid to try new things, and even if it fails, you still learned something. It's ok to use a lot of references and even artists's works as references ! I was so afraid of full bodies art because I'm not used to, now I'm doing pretty ok haha

How to use feeds in bluesky (they’re great!)

1)Select the feeds icon in the middle at the bottom
2)Select the gear to edit at the top right
3)Pin the feeds you want, unpin others
4) On your home page you can now cruise your feeds

For a lot of us, losing Twitter isn’t really about losing ties to the company itself. It’s losing 10+ years of real, asynchronous communities, professional development, the ability to get gigs and clients, the ability to promo/share your art on an extremely broad scale. The loss of that has impact.

It's so tiring yeah, I do hope this one will be good and more people will come. But all my followers, artists pals and clients at the blue bird site are what made me advance. To see it almost gone is so terrifying and sad.

you can make your own media tab, here's how!

-log in to skyfeed.app
-click "feed builder"
-copy the settings below, make an art tag/keyword
-add an icon and a name/description, copy that link.

now you can add that link in your bio, and clicking it will show ONLY your tagged art!
